title: Scores for Multivariate Distributions and Level Sets. (arXiv:2002.09578v6 [math.ST] UPDATED)
abstract: Forecasts of multivariate probability distributions are required for a variety of applications. Scoring rules enable the evaluation of forecast accuracy, and comparison between forecasting methods. We propose a theoretical framework for scoring rules for multivariate distributions, which encompasses the existing quadratic score and multivariate continuous ranked probability score. We demonstrate how this framework can be used to generate new scoring rules. In some multivariate contexts, it is a forecast of a level set that is needed, such as a density level set for anomaly detection or the level set of the cumulative distribution as a measure of risk. This motivates consideration of scoring functions for such level sets. For univariate distributions, it is well-established that the continuous ranked probability score can be expressed as the integral over a quantile score. translated_title: 多元分布与等级集的得分
translated_abstract: 多元概率分布的预测在各种应用中都是必要的。得分规则使得可以评估预测准确性，并比较不同的预测方法。本文提出了一个针对多元分布得分规则的理论框架，其包括现有的二次得分规则和多元连续排名概率得分规则。我们展示了如何使用这个框架生成新的得分规则。在某些多元情境下，需要预测等级集，例如用于异常检测的密度等级集或累积分布的等级集作为风险度量。这促使考虑针对此类等级集的得分函数。对于单变量分布，连续排名概率得分可以表示为分位数得分的积分。我们展示了类似的方法，可以将多元分布的得分规则分解为等级集得分规则。我们提出的框架提供了一种多元得分规则的统一方法，为新的得分函数的开发提供了基础。
tldr: 本文提出了一个针对多元分布得分规则的理论框架，并生成了新的得分规则。同时，展示了如何将得分规则分解为等级集上的得分规则。该框架为多元得分规则的统一方法提供了基础。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a theoretical framework for scoring rules for multivariate distributions, which generates new scoring rules and can be decomposed to obtain scoring functions for their level sets. It provides a unified approach to multivariate scoring rules and offers a basis for the development of new scoring functions.
